paper.title: Large Language Model in Financial Regulatory Interpretation
paper.abstract: This study explores the innovative use of Large Language Models (LLMs) as analytical tools for interpreting complex financial regulations. The primary objective is to design effective prompts that guide LLMs in distilling verbose and intricate regulatory texts, such as the Basel III capital requirement regulations, into a concise mathematical framework that can be subsequently translated into actionable code. This novel approach aims to streamline the implementation of regulatory mandates within the financial reporting and risk management systems of global banking institutions. A case study was conducted to assess the performance of various LLMs, demonstrating that GPT-4 outperforms other models in processing and collecting necessary information, as well as executing mathematical calculations. The case study utilized numerical simulations with asset holdings including fixed income, equities, currency pairs, and commodities - to demonstrate how LLMs can effectively implement the Basel III capital adequacy requirements.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是使用大型语言模型（LLMs）来解析和实施金融监管要求，特别是Basel III资本充足率要求，这直接关联到金融机构的风险管理实践。虽然论文提到了资产组合（如固定收益、股票、货币对和商品），但其主要目的是展示如何通过LLMs实现监管合规，而非投资组合管理或衍生品定价。
